item.title: Images
Dades
item.description:
Gorges du Dadès

Roter Sand und schwarzer Stein —

draußen ist der Himmel kobaltblau.

Schwer atmet der Wind,

im Gorges du Dades,

Schwer atmet dein Wind,

in deiner Brust.

grün schimmert das Wadi uns entgegen

“salut mon Papa, comment allez-vous?”

und Asche tropft von deiner Glut

ich steh hier und lausch den Winden

und frage mich dabei ganz leise

Wieviel Zeit bleibt uns, mon héros?

A poem written on a trip with my dad to Marrakech in November 2025.

item.title: The i-th day
item.description: I think the really difficult thing about chronic diseases is not the disease itself. It is the need to accept the inevitability of its permanence. More specifically, it is the feeling to not be able to cope with it on the i-th day. It is not difficult to live with an alignment for one day, it is not difficult to live with an alignment for 100 days. But it is very difficult to live with an alignment forever. No resource is permanent. And these suckers are very good at grinding you down.

item.title: Graffiti
item.description:
……except from a book, that may or may not be written……

Writing something, somewhere in a public place has always been a go-to tool for those without any other means of resistance to stick it to the current regime. But since the advent of nano-tech coatings and fast clean-up drones, spray and paint have lost their “fuck-the-system” value. But the world keeps spinning and scientific knowledge generally doesn’t want to be tied up like a hooker too careless to agree to some mild bondage play up in the back alley brothels on the soft underbelly of Tokyos shadow world. Now the tool of choice is microbial bio-paint. A mixture of a calcium-rich deployment substrate and lab engineered bacteria that have all but two functions spliced from their genetic composition. The first converts the deployment fuel into highly corrosive fluorinated acid that decomposes anything including hardened glass into a workable canvas to spread “the message”. The second, is a highly optimised gene expression protocol that recombines the available molecules from the canvas and the deployment substrate into a almost indestructible calcium-silicate crust, that remains of a surface longer than the time humans have populated rock-3. Put the fully enriched mixture anywhere and within seconds the gene edited cells will engrave themselves into the surface. Used carefully, you can write anything anywhere and make sure it remains there to be seen until the surface gets demolished. More expensive versions also embed any combination of fluorescence particles into the mix to make artists mental arithmetics against the system pop even more.

item.title: Tokyo
item.description: Sometimes I miss Tokyo to the cellular level. It is insane how much this city has left an imprint on me. In my memory I feel the heat of the asphalt radiating into my face while I am walking through Shimo-kitazawa, Hara-juku or Shibuya after a day of sun in the early summer. It is blissful. It is liberating. It is absolutely fantastic and dread nothing more than to one day feel like I will be too old to do these things. Weltenwandler of this world listen up: just go there and loose yourself in the swirling, steaming whirlpool that is the metropolitan area of Tokyo. Go to the little bars in and have: ビール を いっぱい おねがいします. Get absolutely trashed in a karaoke bar, eat the best seafood at any time of the day, get beers from the next konbini and sit somewhere in the concrete jungle and never, never, never hesitate. And if you have trashed yourself, do the following. Wake up trashed, go to the next sentō and soak yourself in the warms of a steaming hot bath house. Sweat out all the poison. Then get yourself some street ramen and an ice cold beer and life will be good. Live will be whole and fulfilling. Learn how little you need to be content.
